inn1.comm: 120kph, garners a bit of away swing as he pushes the ball full and outside off. Rahane leans into a tentative drive with an open face, gets a thick outside edge through the vacant gully
probes outside the left-hander's off stump as well. The back of a length delivery was a little too far wide though to interest Dhawan
targets the body this time, but Dhawan is ably behind it shortish ball on middle
nice lines from Taylor, keeps pinging away on off stump. Dhawan is brought forward with a hard-handed defence
120kph, that seemed like an offcutter to me. Shortish on middle and leg, Dhawan is a little squared up as he blocks
full and wide outside off, this one is at 119 kph, Dhawan slices it uppishly behind point. That time he was a little less equipped for the change of pace
that went perfectly to script. Tall fast bower hoping for a bit of bounce from this pitch digs it in, only rises as much as his stomach and Dhawan creams it behind square leg with a controlled pull
shortish and on middle and leg, Dhawan tucks it away but can't beat the field
back of a length on off stump, taps it into the covers strongly. That was 122 kph.

big appeal as he gets a good length ball to leap up, duck in and thud into the back thigh of Dhawan. Again his bat comes down from somewhere around gully and it is late to handle the movement. Not out, too high
full and on the pads at 123 kph, Dhawan is more confident against this one as he whips to square leg off the front foot
shortish on off stump at 122 kph, Dhawan pushes it towards cover
124kph, far more confident on this drive as he leans forward and across on his front foot and brings his bat down close to pad for a drill to cover
good length ball shaping away just outside off, Rahane inches towards it and lets it run off the face to third man
good length ball on off stump at 126 kph, Rahane is forward with a dead bat
lovely ball that, teases him with a bit of away swing outside off. Rahane is wise to it and ensures his bat is hoisted well away from its line
short and a bit wide, Rahane could have cracked that through the covers but he checked his shot. Hits on the bottom of the bat towards the covers

that's well timed from Rahane and its enough to reach the short boundary. Good length ball on off stump brings him forward and taps it through the gap between point and cover. So that's the famous high-altitude, bye-bye fielderes, run-away for four
back of a length on the pads, tucked away behind square leg. No bat involved there, says the ump
good length ball and that means it has been given enough to move around. Not that much on offer though, but just enough to make the batsman block with soft hands and run it down to third man
not getting his line right to the left-hander, picked away behind square leg
picks it away from middle stump and it's been caressed along the ground through midwicket. Gorgeous work with the wrists, but this time Benn is able to pull it back by the boundary
back of a good length on off stump, Dhawan looks for a quick single off a soft-handed push down the ground. Not quite as soft as he had hoped
full on off stump at 122 kph, steered towards point off the front foot
126kph, this is full and outside off and was liable to be driven down the ground but Rahane gives himself a tougher task as he waits, pulls out a whip of his wrists to try and beat mid-on. Doesn't
a little shortish on off stump, defended quite tightly
good length ball on middle, Rahane gets forward and tucks it around his front pad quite neatly to square leg
this skids on and strikes Rahane on the pads. Had the batsman playing acorss the line from the crease, but he just about manages an inside edge before it thudded into the knee-roll
seemed as it he had been lured away from the body, but Rahane has controlled the push through the covers expertly. Not as full, but he was wonderfully balanced
thumped between cover and mid-off as he stands up tall behind the shortish ball on off stump. Steve, forgive me for irritating you, but this was 126 kph. Imagine me winking now
keeps going short, keeps sliding down and Dhawan has simply helped it on its' way. Pulled powerfully and well to the right of the deep fine leg. Top shot!
another pull and it somehow seemed more imperious despite going along the ground. Short-ball attack not working at this pace and Dhawan has smashed it in front of square
short and wide outside off stump this time, Dhawan throws his bat at it and finds third man on the deep

full on off stump, at only 124 kph, actually make that overpitched and Rahane has eased this through point. Lovely long stride, and he is playing outside his crease, finds the gap with an open face and it skips away
fullish on off stump, Rahane moves across and nudges it to square leg
back of a length and outside off, seemed rather slow again and the gun says it's 125 kph, Rahane is happy to let it through to the keeper
walks at the bowler, has to adjust to a shorter ball but he does so quite well. Helped that it had a little bit of width and he has slashed it in front of point.
that's a Dhawan special. Leans in to a fuller ball and strokes it through extra cover quite effortlessly. That's where he thrives. West Indies' lengths are suddenly all over the place
affords width now and Dhawan has cracked it in front of point. Brilliant hand-eye coordination made that shot. Watched the ball all the way onto his bat and timed the stroke so precisely
back of a length and outside off, Dhawan does not have too much room, so he blocks
seemed an offcutter, on the pads though. Dhawan isn't able to pick it away
dug in short and it sat up for Dhawan to rock back and pull to the midwicket boundary. Neat little shift of balance, controlled power and emphatic result. West Indies. you're ball...
back of a good length and outside off, not bothered with
good length ball on off stump, gets forward to block
clipped off middle and off stump, he has been quite good with that stroke whenever the ball is pitched up. That uncertain length is when he gets stuck at the crease with a little inswing
straying on the pads again, but Rahane isn't able to connect with his tuck through square leg
shortish and on off stump, Rahane taps it into the covers
gorgeous stroke. Brings a straightish bat down on a good length ball outside off and it streaks away to the sweeper on the off side. Good balance from Rahane
good length and outside off, Rahane will not chase after it. Nice carry
shortish and outside off, slapped away to the sweeper again
pins Dhawan to his crease with a little extra pace, carefully defended though
slower ball, 117 kph, pitched on a good length on off stump, guided to point with an open face
back of a length and on the pads, Dhawan can't connect with his tuck to fine leg
waits on a shortish ball on off stump and taps it towards cover point. Much better over that from West Indies. No room whatsoever
short and wide, a little too much so for Rahane to reach considering he did not move his feet
runs down the track to belt the length ball down the ground. That was stunning from Rahane. Went through with the shot and his timing was, as it usually is, impressive
walks down and across on off stump to pick a length ball away to the fine leg boundary. Beats short fine leg on his left and that was more than enough
slower ball on middle, Rahane adjusts to it and turns it to midwicket
seeks the yorker on middle and off, doesn't quite get it right. Rahane whips but can't beat midwicket

banged in short, but every time that has happened, the batsman has taken it on. Previously it was Dhawan, now it is Rahane who fetches the ball from outside off stump and drops it at the square leg boundary
stays beside a back of a good length ball and lets it run off the open face to deep third man
gets a little lift off the back of a length delivery to thud into Rahane's gloves as he was trying to get up on his toes to tuck it away. Good ball, but better running from India
fullish on off stump, Dhawan gets forward to block confidently
full and wide, Dhawan gets forward, goes down on one-knee but tries to hit a little too hard and the bat face closes on impact. Knows he missed out
back of a length on off stump, pushed down the ground to mid-off. But he was quite deep so single taken
opens the face to run the shortish ball down to third man

gets forward and opens the face to sneak a single to point. All those boundaries have put the fielders right on the edge of the circle, and Russell isn't the most reliable of bowlers to keep things tight
not quite short enough to pull which is why Dhawan is beaten outside his off stump

the short ball has worked, because this time it has pace on it! This was hot at 136 kph, it rose up around his left ear and India have been pulling and hooking all morning. So Dhawan doesn't hold back, mistake there. Gets a top edge and offers a simple catch to deep square leg
good length ball outside off, Rahane covers his off stump and leaves
full and outside off, eased into the covers
fullish on off stump, defended calmly
good length ball on off stump, gets forward to it to block and sneaks a single to the right of cover
good length ball on off stump, Rahane gets forward to block under his eyes
back of a length and outside off, steers it down to deep third man which is big Benn. Looking forward to seeing him bowl
back of a good length and outside off, Kohli lunges forward and shoulders arms. A little too wide to entertain that recent weakness
full on off stump, Kohli gets a giant stride forward and pushes it down the ground. Played a little outside the line and got more of an inside edge though
full and outside off, eased down the ground towards mid-off
good length, outside off, patted to covers
pitched up into his pads and he shows lovely timing again, lets it come on and clips it in front of square for four more

dropped, Taylor at fine leg drops a straightforward catch, Rahane hurried by a short ball as Russell works up some pace again, top edges the hook to Taylor's right, just a few steps away from the fielder, Taylor reaches there, both hands on the ball, and it pops out
short and slanted down the leg side
short again, into the body, Kohli fends it close to the pitch on leg for a single
straightish length ball some way outside off, left alone
a low full toss pushed to extra cover
turn and bounce first ball, Kohli surprised as he is beaten on the back foot
slanted in fuller into the pad, he carefully pushes to midwicket
tosses it up for the drive outside off, Kohli steps forward and eases it to the sweeper
fuller and quicker, around off, he is forward to block
goes on the back foot as he spots a slightly shorter length, but it bounces extra and he cannot time the cut
now he runs it past short third man, Bravo junior after it, pulls it back just inside the rope and tumbles over it, saves a run there
they have been liberal with the short balls, and India keep hooking, top edge falls short of deep square running to his right
solid defence to cover from Kohli as he lets a short of a length ball come on
short ball climbs too much outside off, Kohli tries to take it on, but has to check his pull into the ground, bat more vertical than horizontal, to mid off
has width and will cut powerfully, and send it past the sweeper to the deep backward point rope
pitched up ball around off defended down the track
short again, not getting up too much, and Kohli pummels a pull to the deep midwicket boundary, got right on top of that one
shortish length and spinning away outside off, cut to the sweeper
straightening on middle, tossed up, Kohli stretches right forward to smother it
more flight on the stumps, Kohli happy to push forward
slightly flatter trajectory, and he stays on the back foot, moves across and runs it to short third man, that hurried on
slanted in, good length, middle and leg line, he works it square from the crease
tossed up ball pushed to extra cover
flat and quick into the pad, he is on the back foot and jabs it to midwicket
sitting up this one, but pulled straight to deep midwicket, didnt time that
punched to the bowler off the back foot
turned to square leg from off stump line
bit of flight, Kohli forward right away, defends
full, worked with the spin past midwicket
turned off the pad past midwicket, Russell chases and slides to stop it
straightening on middle, Kohli comes forward and defends
leans forward to a flighted one and pushes it to long off
82.5 kph and bouncing a bit outside off, tapped to point
forward this time and pushes it through point for a single
tossed up slower in the air, Kohli waits and guides it to short third man
taps it towards the non-striker, Samuels thinks Pollard will pick it up, he cannot get there in time, and a single is on
punched down to long on
on the front foot to defend to extra cover
tossed up fuller and much slower outside off, he turns it down to long on
moves across in the crease and turns it past square leg, who isn't exactly haring after it, the batsmen are, and they come back for two
punched off the back foot to the bowler
goes on the back foot, no width on this quickish length ball around off, and it is pushed to the bowler
defended to the off side
tossed up full, whipped to mid on, single completed safely
into the pad, but midwicket prevents the single with a dash to his right
fullish ball outside off, Kohli bends and tries to slap it past short third man, finds the fielder
punched off the back foot wide of long off, and that is fifty for Rahane
tapped off the front foot to point for a single
80 kph flat ball outside off, punched to extra cover
turned from off stump in front of square leg
has the length to rock back, adjust for the bounce and guide it behind point for a couple
whipped from off stump, with the slight turn, to deep midwicket
defended off the front foot
opens the face and runs it behind point for a single
he is coming forward, and this is turning and bouncing away, he adjusts to steer it to short third
thick outside edge as Rahane goes back to punch, flies past a diving Sammy at the lone slip
stays on the crease and defends to cover
full into the pad, and swept down to fine leg
on the back foot to punch to the right of the sweeper for a couple
tossed up ball full on off, turned to deep midwicket
leans on the front foot to defend
punched off the back foot, past midwicket
flatter outside off, he goes back and cuts behind point
whipped off the back foot, from off stump past midwicket

appeal for leg before as he pushes forward to a flighted ball that does not turn much, hit in front of middle, on the inside of middle, had a big stride, there was quite some angle too, umpire Kulkarni does not think that is hitting leg, might have been a thin inside edge
defended solidly off the front foot
has a go at the sweep, inside edges it fine
they go for a sharp single after a drive to wide mid off, Rahane has to dive in, he does, safely done
pushed to mid off
goes deep in the crease to block
pushed through fuller, defended again
turned with the spin to square leg
rocks back, opens up the stance and dispatches it with a pull through midwicket
turned off the pad to square leg
fullish around off, he opens the face and squeezes it behind point
slaps a shortish ball to the right of the sweeper, turns out he has timed it too well
driven off the front foot to the sweeper

another appeal to umpire Kulkarni by Benn against Rahane, who misses a sweep this time, hit below the knee roll, just outside the line of off, and the ball is spinning further away, Rahane has been done in by the combined pressure of the two appeals on umpire Kulkarni
defended off the front foot to the bowler
guides it to short third man
punched off the back foot to long on
flat ball onto the pad, worked in front of square
on the front foot to clip it to short midwicket
turned behind square on the leg side, it is a tight single, and a Raina dive is needed
leans on the front foot to defend
Raina gets going with a skip down the track, he's not to the pitch so he stretches further, gets under the ball and lifts it over long on
on the front foot to push behind point
tackles the bounce on this one turning in to run it behind point
stretches forward and pushes to cover for one
flat ball on the stumps, he stays back to keep it out
tossed up into the pad, he tickles it square
short and wide, Kohli does not attack it, he taps it to the sweeper to keep strike
punched off the back foot to midwicket
turned off middle to square leg
taps it wide of point for another single
pushes straight to extra cover
turned off the pad to deep midwicket
on the front foot to defend to short extra cover
full on off stump, tapped to long on, who messes up the simplest of pick-ups
full and down the leg side, needs a dive from the keeper
excellent timing, this is wide and angling across, but no violence from Raina, he stretches and guides it wide of the sweeper, and it races away
comes forward to push a length ball to extra cover
finds extra cover again as he pushes forward
forward once more to a pitched up ball and eases a drive to long off
full and wide, Raina reaches forward and pushes to sweeper cover
turned to midwicket from the crease
finds midwicket again as he works with the spin
flat and coming in to off, he runs it late and well clear of short third man, almost took that right out of the keeper's gloves
turned to midwicket
full around off, pushed to short midwicket
reaches forward to a wide and ends up chipping it in the air, over point
length ball angled in to middle, tapped to midwicket
slower one, but on the pad, and Kohli gets the requisite tickle on it to move to another ODI fifty, he is human, but the run machine is also coming back
dabs a wide length ball to third man
pushes a back of a length ball to extra cover
taps a length ball in front of cover for a single
fuller on off stump, Raina gets forward to block

keeper and slip are supremely confident, Samuels is a little less so. This was a shortish ball that was pushed through outside off. Raina looks for a late cut, West Indies look for a caught behind, Neithe was successful
good length and on the stumps, defended
goes back to tap a shorter ball through into the off side
leans forward to a good length ball and dabs it into the covers for a single
keeps Raina pinned to his crease with a middle stump line, good defence from Raina
a little shortish and straying on the pads, allows Raina to work it away through square leg
and on cue Bravo pulls out the change of pace, but his radar is wrong. Overpitched and slid down leg, Kohli exhibits a smart whip off his legs, all along the ground to the square leg boundary
shortish and outside off, Kohli reaches out with just his hands and taps it away to deep third man
good length ball tucked away towards midwicket
turned away to the right of midwicket for a single
nips down the track, but Samuels pulls his length back. Keeps Raina to a defensive push. Powerplay going on, by the way
shuffles across on off stump and tucks a length ball into the midwicket region
stays back, opens himself up and taps a length ball through to deep square leg. Neat footwork

that's a go-to stroke for Raina against spin. Runs down the track and even if Samuels isn't one of those bowlers who is easy to get under, he does do exactly that and cracks him for a six down the ground
pushed through on off stump, Raina knew that and waits on his back foot to dab behind point
pushed through on off stump, Kohli whips it away towards square leg and Raina thinks it hits the gap. Not quite, and he has to pull out a full-length dive. Just about makes it
oopsy, that length ball streaks away well down the leg side. Raina too had moved across on off stump and the swipe to square leg can't connect

beautiful slower ball from Bravo, it is a 106 kph offcutter that lures Raina into a push down the ground with hard hands. It hits pretty high on his bat and lobs down the pitch, well to the right of Bravo though. A little love shown at the other end with Bravo hugging Raina with a hand
fullish and on middle, tucked away through square leg
banged in short and outside off, Raina is on the back foot and directs it to the square leg boundary with a pull. Very Ganguly-like
fuller and outside off, pushed into the covers off the front foot. Very tight
another short ball and this time Kohli swivels on his back foot and guides a pull to deep fine leg. A little uppishly, but he needn't have bothered to keep it down with this field
What. A. Shot! It was a good length ball on off stump, the kind that merited a forward defensive, but Kohli extended that and launches the ball over long-off. Sublime
short on off stump, Kohli gets up on his toes and bunts the ball at his feet
another shortish ball just outside off, Kohli keeps to his front foot and steers it towards point. A little gingerly though owing to the lack of pace

banged in on off stump, pulled powerfully by Raina! The short ball isn't so much of a problem at home for him. Russell runs around from square leg and pulls out the big boot. Does well, but then the ball boy steps onto the field, grabs the ball and tosses it back at the fielder. A stunned Russell wonders how he could do that. The umpires have a little chat and they decide that it will be two. Russell gives the errant ball boy a thumbs up. All is well
back of a length on off stump, dropped into the off side with soft hands and run off for a single
shortish on off stump, does it the Raina way as he taps into the off side and runs off
shortish and on the body, tucked away into the mdiwicket region
short again, but at this pace it isn't going to hamper Raina. Pulls strongly, and on the ground, to deep midwicket
goes wide of the crease, but again it is short and Kohli lines it up and pummels it to the square leg boundary. This is getting to be too easy
a slower short ball at 100 kph on off stump, Kohli shuffles across and turns it to Pollard's right
the ploy is not working, but West Indies are not learning. Banged in again, Raina stays in line and hammers it away to the deep square leg boundary. Dismissive
slower and fuller outside off, Raina drives it to long-off
bangs it short again, but it is the change of pace, so Raina was into the shot too early. Gets it off the thigh pad and it dribbles away to the fine leg boundary despite a headlong drive from Holder
full and slide wide outside off, possibly searching for the wide yorker, just about manages to hit the mark and beat Raina's slice
here you go, have a half-tracker says Taylor and Raina says thank you very much with a monstrous pull shot. It got some height, but the bounce was spongy and it just sat up for him to belt
full and outside off, opens the face and gets a single through point
full on off stump, Kohli unleashes those wrists. Brilliant timing, but he can't beat midwicket. Raina was looking for a single and has to invest in a full-length dive again
full toss on leg stump, whipped away to the fine leg boundary. Effortlessly done
it's the slower short ball, Raina has spotted it early and tries to pull it to the right of short fine leg. But Leon Johnson, the sub, does well
pounded away to the man at deep midwicket as Bravo bangs it in short. Dragged it from outside off and hammered it away
gets across on off stump and tucks the length ball away to deep square leg
lets the shortish ball on off stump come on and then guides it off the open face to deep third man
leans into a smart looking drive and he has placed it wide of the man at deep cover to get the two he needs for successive fifties as well.
good length ball on middle and leg, Raina nudges it towards square leg
chops a shortish ball outside off to backward point
seeks the straight drive to a fuller ball outside off, but was into the shot a touch too early. Gets an inside edge down to mid-on
slower ball, but it is on a length and on the pads. Raina swipes it away to deep midwicket
that's a gorgeous stroke. Full of authority on it as it beat cover on his right and mid-off became an usher. Leans forward to an overpitched ball and drove it magnificently
action replay, but there is a long-off in place. Leans into a fuller ball and drills it all along the ground. He definitely has his confidence back
slower ball targeting the base of off stump, driven down the ground past the diving Russell
he seems poised for the short ball, waits on the back foot and smacks it in front of midwicket. Measured strike.
these slower balls are being telegraphed and Raina has got down on one-knee and slogs it over the midwicket boundary with considerable disdain
fuller and outside off, Raina goes for another swipe and gets an inside edge towards midwicket
another slower short ball, guess where it went. Kohli digs down on his back foot and pulls to the midwicket boundary.
this time he gets a little more height on the short ball, but Kohli swivels on the back foot and shows his finesse as he places the ball down to deep fine leg
full on off stump, Kohli was going to flick it away but only manages to tap the ball down the ground. Might have been a bit of a leading edge
full and on the pads, Raina looks for the launch over square leg but wears it on the pads
was that a drop? No it was a bump-ball. Kohli went down with a low full toss and tries to scythe the gap between point and cover point, Smith is good behind it
fuller and on off stump, slices the ball to point
full on leg stump, inviting that seemingly invincible full swing of his arms. Raina obliges and sends the ball into orbit over long-on. Slower balls, begone
full and outside off, Raina drills the ball through the covers
full and wide outside off, Kohli gets across and drives through to deep cover
offcutter outside off, Kohli gets forward and strikes it to cover
another slower ball, a little shorter and outside off. Kohli lets it slide away to deep third man
backs away to slice a good length ball just outside off through to deep third man. Doesn't connect

the guide to third man does him in! And in other news an offcutter works! Gets a little more bounce off the deck after the seam hits it and takes the outside edge rather high on the angled bat and Ramdin dives to his left to pick up a smart catch.
slanted into the pads, Dhoni whips it away to deep midwicket
is this going to be a double-strike? Nope. Good ball again from Taylor as his offcutter holds in the pitch again and cuts Kohli in half as he was looking to flick.
Dhoni wears a back of a length delivery on his pads, Holder's bounce can be a little ungainly to handle early in the innings
more bounce again for Holder and Kohli shouldn't have been on the front foot for that. Pushes at it with hard hands and misses.
good length ball on middle, Kohli moves to leg and taps the ball into the covers
seeks the yorker on middle, Dhoni ensures his feet don't get in the way and whips it to midwicket. Half a helicopter there
runs down the track and hammers a length ball through to the sweeper on the off side. Dhoni seems to be in a mood today
gets down the track, Holder adjusts his length to bowl short. Kohli uses the room on it to tap it down to third man for a single. 99 and retains strike

flicks this length ball straight to the fielder at midwicket but sloppy work there by Darren Bravo - he gives away over throws at the striker's end -  allows the run that brings Kohli's 20th ODI century.. Huge moment.. a big relief for Kohli after the summer he has had
this is madness! Drop at deep square leg, missed run out at the striker's end after the throw comes in, then overthrows.. Sloppy sloppy work everywhere

this is not sloppy! Pollard takes down the stumps with a flat throw from long-on and Dhoni could be in trouble.. Yes.. this is brilliant work from the fielder now. It was driven firmly straight down the ground and Pollard had to quickly move to his left.
now what, another dropped catch! Their minds are not on the fields today.. The captain drops a straightforward chance at midwicket. Waist high..
he is going to hurt you if you can't take simple catches.. Kohli spots the slower one and hammers it over long on with a lot of bottom hand
another slower ball, Kohli flicks it to wide long on for a single.. There is Pollard there, who hits the stumps direct again.. And they take another overthrow.. What can i say..
Does he get there! Noo.. Leon Johnson charges in from long on to get under this skier but just couldn't get under it. Jadeja didn't get hold of that pull shot at all

catch has been taken people! Jadeja gets a low full toss but he slices it to mid-off. Easy chance really.. They could not have messed that up. The umpire wants to check for the no-ball but there is no luck for Jadeja
Pollard does well at short third man to quickly retrieve the ball... Kohli was looking to hit the slower ball out of the ground but gets a thick edge that lands behind Pollard
he walks over to the off side looking for that gap behind short fine leg, but doesn't get hold of the pull, picks up a single to backward square leg
charges out of the crease and slices a highish full toss to deep backward point for a couple

another missed chance! Holder had all the time to hit the stumps at the striker's end but he misses and Rayudu survives. It was a solid yorker and Kohli somehow kept it out.. he called for the single but Rayudu would have been miles out

that doesn't look like it came of the middle.. that is because the bat swings flatter, but the ball goes higher.. but looks like Kohli has pulled it well.. very well in fact, it goes way over the deep backward square leg boundary

half-hearted appeal for lbw from behind the stumps, but the bowler knows there is some bat on it. It was a superb yorker and Kohli somehow manages an inside edge that grazes the pads and rolls to the boundary at fine leg.. Nothing going West Indies' way
he looks to make room but the bowler follows him with another good yorker, Kohli can only dig it out towards midwicket
another full delivery, the batsman gets an inside edge to deep backward square leg
moves towards the leg side and drags a slower bouncer to deep midwicket with a flat hit, a fielder there so just a single
keeps it around the blockhole, the batsman jams his bat at that and pushes it past the stumps at the non-striker's ends for a single
he comes down the pitch and gets a high full toss, it hits the bat near the maker's name as he looks to hit it down the ground.. played to long off without any timing
that has probably some snow flakes on it when it comes down.. Another high full toss and that is murdered with a hammer, over deep midwicket
he looks to make room but the bowler pushes it wide outside off and Rayudu can't reach it
bowls a good yorker that the batsman can only push to extra cover
slower delivery, Kohli's bottom-handed drive down the ground serves him well again as he pushes it to long on.. Hello, they have stolen a second as Russell takes ages to throw the ball back..
the innings ends with a run-out.. Kohli misses the yorker but takes off for a bye.. Unlike Russell, Ramdin releases the ball early and Holder does the rest

inn2.comm: massive inswing for Bhuvneshwar and his hits the batsman on the pads.. but that was just too much swing and it was heading down the leg side.. Smith Swung his bat at that like they needed a six of this ball
he plays a loose drive and this cuts the batsman in half! Another massive inswinger.. It was just short of length and so bounced over the stumps.
now he decides to play a defensive shot, pushes it down towards mid on
superb! This is almost like a boomerang.. well 25% at least. He bends it like Beckham and cuts the batsman in half again, over the middle stump
he comes forward and gets behind the line, defends it to cover
keeps bringing it in, the batsman defends it down to mid-on
bowls it full and gets the shape into the left-hander, Bravo pushes it wide of mid-on for a quick single
bowls a skiddy back of length delivery around off stump, Smith whips it straight to midwicket
lets this one go through seeing it has a nice away shape on it. Two slips lay in wait

loud appeal for caught behind as the batsman misses his pull shot completely! It was not short enough to pull, Smith still goes for the shot.. It flicks the pad en route to the keeper. Wasn't far from the off stump either
nice shape again, this time the batsman lets it go through

India are not going to drop these skiers! Shami settles under this cloud-burster and takes it comfortably at mid-on. Smith, again, looks to pull one that is not so short, ends up getting a big top edge.
he gets off the mark with a dab towards cover. Takes a couple of steps down the pitch to get closer to the delivery
pitches on leg stump and gets it to move away, Bravo stays solidly behind that one and defends it down the pitch
he stays solid and pushes this length delivery wide of mid-on for a comfortable single
bowls length outside off, not much movement this time, the batsman lets it through to Dhoni
he gets hit on the pads as he walks down the pitch.. More inward movement for BHuvi.. But the impact was quite high
attempts a bouncer but this is well down the leg side
this one leaves the batsman! Pollard didn't expect it to, gets beaten as this flies past the outside edge
swings it in into the batsman, who gets hit on the thigh pad as he looks to clip it to leg side
keeps it tight around off stump, the batsman shuffles across and gets behind it solidly to defend it down the pitch
he stays on the back foot to defend this short of length delivery, gets a thick outside edge to third man
he comes behind the line of the ball, defends it solidly to the off side
he remains solid, doesn't want to give it away, defends it down the pitch
pushes it to backward point, playing at this as it swings away, keeps the slip cordon interested
what timing! He merely puts his bat to this one.. pushes it past the forward short leg fielder as this one shapes in, it picks up speed after crossing the fielder
pushes this length ball down to mid-on with soft hands and calls for an early single
he takes a step down the pitch and gets solidly behind this one, defends it down towards mid on
length delivery wide outside off, the batsman leaves it alone
pushes it wide outside off, Pollard leaves it alone again
this one is too wide, swings further away and Dhoni takes it in front of first slip
superb delivery! It is angled in from wide of the crease and then it leaves the batsman late, flies past the outside edge
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
back of length around off stump, Bravo stays patient, defends it to the leg side
this one swings down the leg side but Mr Kulkarni thinks it's an ok delivery.. doesn't call it a wide
back of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman pushes it towards wide of mid on for a single
short of length, Pollard fends it to deep backward square leg, taking his one hand off the bat.. Couple of meters to the right of forward short leg fielder
he is being solid, defends this back of length delivery to the off side
keeps bowling that wide of off line, Pollard allows it to go through
wide outside off again, and again, Pollard is not interested
he looks to leave this one but it's the inswinger, hits him on the thigh pad. The fielder from second slip is alert and fires a throw back at the stumps, as Pollard was out of his crease, but misses
another big inswinger, Pollard looks to flick but gets hit on the pads. But this was heading down the leg side
brilliant bowling! this one now jags away from the batsman, who leaves it alone

whacks him on the helmet! That is not more than 125 kph. But Pollard is under a spell. He looks to duck under the short of length delivery.. but cannot get out of the way.. The ball ricochets to the fine-leg boundary
length delivery angled across the lefty, the batsman leaves it alone
length delivery on the stumps, again defended by the bowler
keeps angling it across the left-hander, who lets it go through this time
back of length delivery on the leg stump line, the batsman looks to clip but gets hit on the thigh pad, picks up a leg bye to square leg
shuffles across but gets a skiddy one on the middle stump line.. it's the inside edge that saves Pollard here.. it rolls towards square leg and they take a single
swings this one down the leg side, called a wide
back of length on the stumps, Bravo is happy to defend everything
gets it to shape away from short of length, but the lack of pace on that allows Pollard to defend it towards point comfortably
edged and just falls short of Raina at second slip! Raina dives to his right to stop that running away
now this one curves in to Pollard and he can't get it away, gets hit on the thigh pad
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it to midwicket now
some attempt after a while to play a forcing shot! The batsman looks to hit this on the up through off, but gets an inside edge to mid on
this one swings down the leg side, easy call for the umpire
looks for the booming drive again! And again, he gets an inside edge. This one is behind square on the leg side
he is bowling it on a tight line around the off, brings it in to the batsman who defends it down the pitch
he stays in the crease and pushes this softly towards mid-off for a quick single
finally he is able to get some bat as he flicks this to deep square leg.. probably because it is Umesh who is not swinging as much as Bhuvi..
loose shot! Short of length and swinging away, and Pollard plays a T20 shot, trying to hit it on the up, gets beaten completely
length delivery on the stumps, he is a bit unsure of the movement as he defends it down the pitch
he wants the big shot again! Charges down the pitch and looks to chip it over mid-on, but is beaten completely by the away swing
stands tall and punches the back of length delivery to the off side, but can't beat the fielder at point
he stays back and punches the back of length delivery to deep cover for a single
beaten again! By the away swinger. His feet remain rooted to the crease as he pokes at this length delivery
length delivery on off, the batsman defends it to the off
very close! This was only a nanometer away from the leg stump.. Pollard had left this one, but he had shuffled too far to the off side.. I am not even sure he was playing for the inswing

Bhuvi puts an end to Pollard's misery, with a perfect outswinger! It pitches on off, doesn't swing like a banana, just jags away enough to catch the outside edge which is gobbled up at first slip by Dhawan
length ball on off, Bravo defends it off the back foot, pushes it to mid off
he leans on to this one and punches it to deep cover, playing on the up
he gets a welcome to the pitch with a sharp bouncer! Samuels tries to duck but gets hit on the shoulders
gets squared up as he tries to defend this length delivery, but the outside edge takes it to third man
he chases this length delivery and slashes at it, that flies flat over backward point and through to the boundary
swings it in from wide of the crease, the batsman looks to push it to the leg side but gets hit on the pads, picks up a leg bye
gets this length ball to seam away from the batsman, left alone
again that away shape from round the wicket, it's wide enough for Bravo to leave
brings it closer to the stumps this time, but Bravo shows good judgement, leaving this one alone too
on the off stump now, Bravo comes forward and defends it to the leg side
he comes forward and punches this length delivery to deep cover for a single
ends the over with a smart inswinger! Samuels tries to have a poke at that but plays inside the line, misses
oh Rayudu!! This one was just a clip to deep backward square leg, but Rayudu slips over it and gives away a boundary.. The outfield, by the way, is a wet carpet
back of length outside off, the batsman dabs it to cover and calls for a quick single
he looks to fend this short of length delivery, but it runs down fine on the leg side off the arm guard
back of length on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
gets this one to move in sharply off the pitch, Samuels gets surprised by it, gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
defends the length delivery towards point
length delivery outside off, the batsman leaves it alone
too much width given! First shot of authority after a while as Samuels stands tall and punches it through extra cover.. No feet movement, just a heavy bat
tries to repeat the shot but plays it to Kohli at mid-off
doesn't move his feet but looks to punch it through off, ends up pushing it to mid-on as the bat turns in his hand
stays back and defends the back of the length delivery to off
easily done! He just chips this length delivery over cover with utmost ease, picks up a single as there is a fielder in the deep

how has that missed! It's the ball that helped him shock West Indies in Tests in the past, channels that inswinger off  a fuller length and has Samuels looking quite inept. No footwork, leads with his hands and is beaten as soundly as can be
what a reply! Enjoys a shorter ball as he stays back and thumps it through the covers. Ample flair in that shot
round three to Shami, he had a short leg in wait and sends down a bouncer that angles in at the batsman's helmet. Samuels attempts to hook, but it's too quick for him
127 kph, good length ball tucking him up on middle and leg. Some inswing again keeps Samuels honest
another short ball, and the direction is excellent too. Forces Samuels off his feet as he gets caught between ducking and swaying away. This pitch has quickened up under lights
slides a good length ball down the leg side, Samuels' flick can't connect

slapped down the ground! How did he do that? He stayed back to a fuller ball, ensured he had enough room to throw his hands at it. But he did so with a straight bat and hammered a flat six over long-off
fuller on middle and leg, defended cautiously
fuller and a shade outside off, leans forward and caresses it through the covers
oh, that's sublime! Meets an overpitched ball angled in at him and drills it down the ground for a sweet boundary
the angle from around the wicket isn't working for Kohli, he's sliding on the pads and Bravo just had to place it well enough to beat square leg on the boundary and he does so
glorious strokeplay  from Bravo, this time he stands up tall beside a short ball outside off and cracks it in front of point with pure class
back of a length on off stump at 131 kph, Samuels leaps back and blocks with soft hands
good length, but the switch of angle around the wicket makes this slide down the leg side.
banged in on leg stump and Bravo shuffles inside the line and fends it behind square leg. Good work that
tucked away to short leg as he stays in line with a shortish ball on middle
banged in again, at 126 kph, Samuels backed away to engender a slash over point but he had moved a little too far away from the ball
130kph, that's the fifty-partnership but it doesn't come up convicingly. Samuels is hurried by the short ball, gets it off the splice of the bat and it loops over short leg
whips a shortish ball away off his pads to deep fine leg
pushed through on off stump, Bravo defends back to the bowler
backs away and cracks a shortish ball through to the sweeper. Lovely footwork to make himself a little room
a little slower through the air, but it goes on with the angle in at Samuels and he is able to clip it behind square leg
he isn't getting any spin with a wet ball, Bravo though hasn't taken that into account and plays for it. The ball beats his outside edge
good length ball on off stump, he keeps to his crease to block

skids on off a fuller length, Bravo sought to late cut it but isn't able to put bat to ball. Throws his head back in disappointment. Wonder if it was because he couldn't connect, or for his shot selection

Samuels was moving leg side to make a little room, but shortish and angled into his body. Only think he can do is block, but he seems to be suffering from a bit of cramp. Goes down immediately and the physio runs out for some assistance. Meanwhile a couple of ropes are run around the outfield to gather up some dew
pulls the bottom hand off the bat as he slices a shortish ball through the covers. Needed to do that to place the ball where he wanted
no trouble posed by a short ball on the pads, Bravo calmly works it to deep square leg. Cricket's equivalent of a yawn?
banged in again and slides down leg again. Is Shami tiring from all the short ball attack? This type of bowling is preferably used in two-three overs spells
he's hit him! Another short ball makes Samuels go for the pull, a very awkward one at that, and is hit on the back of the helmet. Lovely aggression
back of a length on Samuels' body, he gets inside the line to tickle it fine but Dhoni is aware of the tactic and dives to his left
another short ball to end the over and this time Samuels has spotted it early and ducks
pushed through down leg, Bravo will feel disappointed his tuck finds short fine leg

sinks down on one-knee as he realises he has dragged the ball onto his stumps. These darts as his best weapon and it fools Bravo into thinking it was shorter than it actually was. Looks set for a swipe, but it skids on, deflects off the thigh pad and onto leg stump
tossed up on off stump, Ramdin gets forward to block
flighted on off stump as Ramdin practices another forward defensive
pushed through on off stump, Ramdin gets back and punches the ball down to mid-off
good length on middle, Ramdin goes back and blocks. Had to hurry into the stroke too
flighted on off stump, Samuels opens the face towards point
a little turn for Jaddu though, he slows it up on middle and leg, Samuels looks for a tuck through midwicket and only gets a leading edge as the ball grips and turns across
pushed through on middle, Samuels pushes down the ground
a little short and Samuels makes it worse as he backs away outside leg. But point dives full-length to the right to keep it to a single
tossed up on middle and leg, Ramdin settles into a defensive push but gets an inside edge onto pad
backs away and cracks it through to the sweeper on the off side
drives a good length ball through the covers
good line and length this from Akshar, cramps him on off stump and keeps him to a defensive push
slides on with the arm and Samuels is only able to get a bit of pad towards square leg
he tries to stay beside a fuller ball and drive through the off side, but Akshar bowls flat and it goes on with the arm. Gets an inside edge down the ground
taps a shorter ball through the covers
pushed through on middle again, Ramdin blocks
runs down the track and gets to the pitch and drives through the line to long-off
flighted on middle, Ramdin looks for a drive through extra cover but gets an inside edge. They should stop playing for turn with so much dew
runs down the track and plays the angle, but he hasn't reached the pitch properly. Gets a leading edge over the covers
neatly caressed through the covers
good length ball on middle and off, defended into the covers.
round-arms this fuller delivery in at the base of leg stump, Ramdin hastens to protect it. Akshar runs to his right and dives to keep it to none
pushed through on middle, Ramdin keeps it out
a little shorter and that allows Ramdin to stay low and pull to deep square leg
flighted in on middle and off, Samuels defends with an open blade and soft hands into the covers
goes on with the arm on middle and leg, Ramdin can only punch it back down the ground
fired in on middle and off, Ramdin drives back at the bowler
runs down the track to a good length ball and punches it back at the bowler
this time his trip down the track yields better results as he gets under a flighted ball and hammers it down the ground. Big six over long-off

another belligerent shot straight over the bowler's head. Good use of the feet to gather momentum for the stroke and even though he wasn't quite to the pitch, he went through with the shot and it had a punch to it
looped up slower and wider outside off, Samuels follows it with his arms again and gets a thick edge that goes too fine for short third man
magnificent strike, this time off the back foot. There were a lot of those in Kochi. Plays the cut so late and hits the gap between backward point and deep third man
tossed up outside off, Samuels leans into a drive through extra cover. Dhawan, the sweeper, gets another work out
good length ball on middle, Ramdin enjoys an inside edge into the midwicket region
pushed through on the pads, Samuels taps it by his feet on the leg side
backs away and tries a cut, but he isn't able to connect
taps a good length ball down the ground and raises his 24th ODI fifty. Important innings in the context of this chase and he needs to convert it into a big one
backs away and slaps a flatter ball from the stumps to deep point. Risky, but that seems to be the best way to milk Akshar
pushed through on middle and leg, Ramdin tries to make some room but his chop able to pierce the gap in the covers

he never stays down too long. Has Ramdin holed out on the square leg boundary with an innocuous little delivery. Essentially it is just a good length ball on middle, it invited the slog sweep but Ramdin should have added a lot more power than he should have
gets back and plays with the turn for a quick single to short third man
flighted on middle and leg, Bravo lunges forward and taps it back to the bowler

double-strike! You cannot keep Jaddu out of the game. He gets a good length ball to skid on quicker. Bravo expects turn and plays outside the line, which means his pad is right in front of middle and leg stump. And that is what the ball hits. Easy decision
flighted on middle, Sammy gets forward and taps it down the ground. Jaddu was trying to flick the ball back at the non-strikers' stumps to get a run-out, but only concedes a single
goes back and taps a good length ball down the ground
pulls the pace back on this as he targets a line outside off, eased away into the point region
fired in down the leg side, possibly to enact a stumping, but Samuels does not lose balance

huge excitement from the fielders here! Has Samuels forgotten to be careful here? Not at all. This was a good length ball that he sliced to point. Saw there was no single there and got back in well in time before the ball was flicked onto the stumps rather casually by MS Dhoni
goes back on leg stump and taps it to extra cover
finds the gap through the covers as he makes room and taps a good length ball with an open face
goes on with the arm on leg stump, punched towards midwicket
makes room, and that seems to be the only way to play against this stifling line of attack, and cracks behind point
turn! Gets it to drift in on off stump, grip on the pitch and weave away past the prodding outside edge of Sammy's bat
flighted on middle and leg, defended into the midwicket regoin
keeps to his crease and blocks a good length ball on off stump
tossed up on middle and leg, Sammy pushes back down the ground. Jadeja does not let it pass on his right
a little slower through the air, Sammy adjusts and taps it towards point
flighted on middle and leg, Sammy lunges forward to block and plays out a maiden
flatter ball on off stump, Samuels prefers the back foot and dabs in front of point
pushed through on middle and leg, Sammy is still not confident of the pace of this pitch and wears it on the pads
shortish and on the stumps, Sammy hammers it down to long-on
clears his front leg to a rather fuller delivery and slaps it towards short cover
opens the face to slice a good length ball through towards short third man
stays beside a good length ball and pushes it to short cover
tossed up on off stump, Sammy drives to long-off. Looks like he is really trying to play a long hand

runs down the track and launches Jadeja over long-on. Looks like he's picked the bowler he likes best and is treating him. Not perhaps in the way he would like though. Clean strike over long-on after he ran down the track. Doesn't turn, Samuels loves it
encore! Jadeja bowls that mechanical good length and it seems to be working against him as Samuels runs down the track and launches him straight over his head
fired in full on middle and leg, Samuels gets beside it and creams it through the covers. All along the ground. Some brilliant strokeplay against spin right now
saw the batsman charging him and sneaks a fuller, flatter ball at the pads. Succeeds in keeping him quiet
picked away in front of square leg. Samuels is looking key for this chase.
punched on the up, lots of power and timing behind that, but straight to cover
fuller and wider outside off, Sammy crunches it through backward point.. lots of wheels on that shot, pings the boundary
attempts a slower one, the batsman pushes it straight to cover
that's awesome power from Sammy! It's a short one outside off and Sammy just flat bats it like Nadal, smashes it to the deep midwicket boundary
he dabs this one with soft hands to extra cover, calls early for a quick single
rolls his finger on this length delivery outside off, Samuels guides it down to third man
darts this one on the pads, the batsman tickles it to backward square leg
slower, but not full enough, the batsman nudges it to square leg this time
flatter and shorter on the stumps, no room for the batsman, he pushes it to the right of the bowler
flatter and on the middle and leg line, defended down the pitch
pushes this one through, but this is well down the leg side
keeps it tight around the leg stump line, no room for Samuels, who has to defend
another one darted in towards leg stump, the batsman gets an inside edge to square leg
looks to push the length ball to the off side, but gets an inside edge down towards long on
he gets his front leg out of the way to slap this short of length delivery over point, but it skids past the outside edge
he moves to the leg side and punches the angled delivery through cover, a single to the deep
he just stands tall and punches this on the up, and it lands only a few feet short of wide long off..
whoa!! Unbelievable shot! The batsman was making room but he gets a bouncer outside off, which Samuels manages to whack to cow corner.. while rolling his wrists on it to keep it down..
bowls another skiddy one on short of length, the batsman looks for the single to third man but makes no contact

oh that goes nowhere! Sammy opened his stance and wanted to whack it somewhere, but Akshar pushes this one quick, and short, towards Sammy, cramping him for room. Sammy goes through with his lofted shot, but gets hit high on the bat.. manages to lob it back for the bowler. Akshar is a tall guy, takes a simple overhead chance
slower this time from Akshar, Russell defends it to the off side
he leans forward and pushes this quicker delivery to cover
stays back and pushes it to the right of mid-on for a quick single. Direct hit and he was a gonner
looks to drive on the up, but doesn't get the timing, pushed to cover
fired on the pads, the batsman fails to get it away and is rapped on the pads
woohoo! It's full and it's wide, somehow Russell gets under it and slices it over backward point.. just out of the reach of the fielder
gets on the back foot and defends the back of length delivery to point
send him to hollywood to play Thor! That is one powerful hammer.. He clears his front leg out and kills the ball to the midwicket boundary..
fuller delivery on the stumps, now he calmly pushes it to cover
this is through the gap at point! It wasn't very far from the diving fielder, but once it's past him, it just speeds away on this frictionless outfield
there is no one behind point so Russell throws his bat at this fuller delivery, does well as he slices it over the infield easily and gets a one-bounce four
tossed up a bit, the batsman drives it back to the bowler
comes down the pitch and drives it back to Akshar again
fired on the pads, the batsman clips it straight to square leg
on the leg stump line, the batsman pushes it to deep midwicket for a single
slower this time, the batsman comes forward and defends it to the leg side
looks to cut it through off, but gets a thick bottom edge, it wasn't far from the leg stump as it rolls towards short fine leg
tosses it up on the leg stump line, the batsman comes down the pitch but doesn't connect.. Takes a leg bye as the ball rolls off his pads towards point
attempts the reverse sweep but Jadeja is firing them down the leg side, the batsman misses.. Not called a wide even though the keeper takes it way down the leg side
now plays a conventional flick shot as he knows they are all being fired in, and does it well, finds the gap at deep square leg
oh man! This is murdering jadeja's figures.. and with a murderous hit. Pulls out the slog sweep, a proper one.. sends it on the top row in the stand at deep square leg. What a strike!
this air is thin! It looks more of a top edge as Russell goes for another sweep, but this is way back in the stand behind long leg.. superb hitting.. Jadeja being carted around
fires it full on the pads, the batsman takes it on the full and drives it in the gap at wide long-on.. Rahane slides and prevents the boundary
he comes down the pitch but is not exactly to the pitch of the delivery, still chips it to deep midwicket for a single
bowls it with a bit of round-arm action, quicker one, the batsman has no room, so defends
shuffles about in the crease while the bowler is in his run up, then plays a conventional drive to long on for a single
easy one for Samuels! He takes a step down the pitch and just chips it over the bowler's head.. it goes all the way.. That's the first boundary off Akshar
comes down the pitch again, driven to long on along the ground this time
fired on the blockhole and the batsman can't do much with it.. digs it out
bowls a length delivery around middle and leg, the batsman has no room but manages to tuck it behind square on the leg side
that's a golf swing! He gets his front leg out of the way and hits the full delivery cleanly over the umpire's head.. Lots of power.. the long on fielder had no chance
fires a beautiful yorker, right on the base the stumps.. Russell has no room and can only dig it out down the pitch
length, and this has disappeared! If you have seen the pictures of the ground.. this has hit the roof of the pavilion.. That was killed.. Wicket shot

it all ends with the stumps being splayed! It's a length delivery aimed at the middle stump, but Russell, who was hitting it so well down the ground, looks to play a cheeky late cut and misses.. loses the middle stump
he pulls this one comfortably down to fine leg to get off the mark
fuller delivery on off, Holder drives it comfortably to deep cover for a single
angles this one in from wide of the crease, Samuels wants a quick single with a dab to the off side, but he ends up pushing it down the pitch
slower one, on the stumps, Samuels defends it back to the bowler
length delivery outside off, he gets some room, so he cuts it down to third man for a single
he comes forward and drives it down the ground for a single to long on
slower delivery, no room given, the batsman can only pick up a single to point

did those long strides of Holder help him out there? I think they did and the third umpire will confirm that. This was a quicker ball on leg stump, picked away through midwicket and two runs taken. Direct hit, but that was excellent running
worked away through midwicket again as he shuffles across on off stump to whip a length ball that was on off stump
Holdaaaa! Runs down the track and blasts Jadeja down the ground. He can bat, don't worry about it
found-armed in on off stump, Holder lifts it over covers with a kind of languid ease. His timing is striking, as it was in the Tests against New Zealand
full toss on off stump, Holder taps it down to long-off calmly
fired in flat and quick on leg stump, Samuels hopes to pick it away on the leg side but doesn't get it far enough from Jadeja
seeks the yorker on middle and leg, but it comes out as the next best - a very low full toss - drilled down the ground to long-off
legcutter on off stump, Samuels has lined it up and guides it into the point region

oopsy, he has carved a full toss to Raina at extra cover. Holder's game is more about touch and this equation was asking him to play a very different one. Clears his front leg away and looks to clear the off-side infield, but he has miscued it
and the back of a length ball on middle finds him. Tucked away quite calmly to midwicket
good length ball angled in at Taylor, worked away into the leg side. Look like Samuels has asked him to simply stick around
slides this length ball off the open face towards point
digs it into the blockhole on leg stump and Samuels is happy to dig it out down the ground and take a single
banged into the middle of the pitch, which allowed Taylor to line it up early and duck under it
worked away to the right of short midwicket, although he wasn't too keen to get behind this fast, shortish ball on middle and leg
oh that is classy! He removes his front leg from getting in the way of a drill through extra cover. Stands and deliverys and the fielder can't do much
good length ball on middle and off, Samuels works it away to the left of midwicket. He's 99 now
those are always handy. Shami digs another bouncer on a middle stump line, Taylor pulls blind and gets a top edge that sails over the keeper
full on leg stump, Samuels has clipped it quite deftly past the short fine leg. Off goes the helmet, and up comes the bat. Brilliant century, but can he take the side through?
slogs a length ball away from middle stump to deep midwicket
that's brilliant work from Taylor! He was not duped by the offcutter, made some room for himself to take advantage of a shorter length and timed the late cut to perfection.
moves around the wicket and sends down a yorker on leg stump. Taylor almost trips over his feet digging it out and returns the strike to Samuels
sneaks the yorker between Samuels' splayed feet as he was trying to whip it away through midwicket.
full and on the base of middle stump, so that's three yorkers in a row, but Samuels drives to long-off
sticks to bowling around the wicket and this ends up a low full toss on middle, Samuels belts it down to long-on

off stump cartwheeels. Dhoni tends to it as he comes up to celebrate. Ravi Shastri liked it too, judging from his applause. This was a good length ball on off stump, Taylor backed away to try and smoke it over the covers. Misses, Shami hits
142 kph short ball directed at Benn's chest. Manages to fend it away well enough, but that was ball thudding into bat
full on the base of leg stump, drilled to long-on
works the full delivery from middle stump to deep midwicket
129kph, the yorkers are hitting their mark more often than not today. Samuels can't get under it enough to make anything out of it
that's a lovely touch. Umesh misses the yorker by a few inches and Samuels brings down the angled face and slices the ball through point. Skims away. Now Dhoni plugs that gap
but that opened up fine leg and Umesh's line enabled this whip. Goes full, but slides it a touch more down leg than he would have liked. Even with the batsman making room
131 kph, fires it in nice and full on leg stump, Samuels whacks it down to long-on
135kph, dug in just outside off, Benn weaves his torso away and dab the ball towards point
good length ball at 132 kph, tapped into the covers with minimum footwork
clears his front leg to crack a full ball over extra cover, but he misses and Shami hits. Timberrrr! So a very tumultuous game comes to an end in an immensely emphatic fashion.
